title: Who made the Universal Studios theme music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Universal Studios has changed their iconic logo over the years, along with many variations for the studio’s specific films. The newest and best known Universal theme tune was written by music composer and film conductor Jerry Goldsmith in 1997. Goldsmith's new music and updated logo - first seen in Jurassic Park II: The Lost World.  For Universal's 100th Anniversary, they premiered a new logo in 2012 with Illumination’s The Lorax (the animation studio that created the Despicable Me franchise). Goldsmith's tune is adapted and arranged by Brian Tyler.   Speaking of Illumination, the Minions, the mascot characters from Despicable Me provide a vocal version of the theme, with a never-ending finish. This version also appears on the film’s soundtrack.  {^__^} That’s your answer about the iconic Universal logo theme which was composed by the late and great Jerry Goldsmith (February 10, 1929 – July 21, 2004).
